item.title: The law on civil liability for Internet publishing clarified by the CJEU
item.description:
Analyzing the Papasavvas Case: Intermediary Liability in the Digital Age This post examines the recent Court of Justice of the European Union (CJEU) ruling in the Papasavvas case, which explores the definition of “intermediary” in EU information technology law. This issue has become increasingly complex since the drafting of the eCommerce Directive in 2000, as the digital landscape has evolved to include services blurring the lines between content providers and transmitters...

item.title: Salesman's Vacation: CJEU provides clarification on holiday pay calculation
item.description:
By Steve Peers The EU’s Working Time Directive is frequently a source of contention in the UK. However, certain workers, especially those who might not otherwise receive it, appreciate the four weeks of paid annual leave it guarantees.
